meanings.definition: To fulfill the desires, expectations, needs, or demands of (someone).
meanings.sent1: I made sure to satisfy my friend's hunger by cooking his favorite meal.
meanings.sent2: Eating a delicious meal can satisfy your hunger and make you happy.
meanings.sent3: When the pizza delivery guy arrived, he said, 'I hope this pizza can satisfy your growling stomach!'
meanings.sent4: Her laughter satisfied his ears like a soothing melody on a quiet night.
meanings.sent5: The feeling of a warm hug can satisfy your heart more than any words can.

meanings.definition: To provide (someone) with enough of what is wanted or needed.
meanings.sent1: The generous portions of food on the plate were enough to satisfy the hungry guests.
meanings.sent2: A good night's sleep can satisfy your body's need for rest and rejuvenation.
meanings.sent3: The overflowing fountain of chocolate sauce was there to satisfy every sweet tooth in the room.
meanings.sent4: The rain finally came to satisfy the thirsty earth, bringing life to the dry soil.
meanings.sent5: The library had a vast collection of books to satisfy the curiosity of any reader.
